holidays.name: Relaxation Day
holidays.description: A perfect excuse to unwind, kick back, and indulge in some guilt-free relaxation. Whether it‚Äôs a nap, a spa day, or just sitting quietly, this day is dedicated to doing nothing and enjoying it to the fullest.
holidays.origin: Started in 1985 by a small group of wellness advocates who felt the world needed a reminder to slow down, Relaxation Day has grown into a popular mental health observance.
holidays.funFact: Spanish researchers found that just 10 minutes of relaxing activities can reduce stress by up to 30%!

holidays.name: National Thrift Shop Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the thrill of the find and the sustainable joy of shopping secondhand! This day champions thrift stores and all the quirky treasures you can discover in them.
holidays.origin: Started by thrift shop enthusiasts and environmentalists in the 1980s to promote recycling and reusing through secondhand shopping.
holidays.funFact: Thrift shopping is a billion-dollar industry that helps reduce millions of tons of textile waste annually.

holidays.name: National Lemon Meringue Pie Day
holidays.description: A delightful day dedicated to the tangy-sweet masterpiece of lemon meringue pie ‚Äî crisp crust, tart lemon filling, and cloud-like meringue topping!
holidays.origin: An American food holiday likely started by baking enthusiasts and pie lovers keen to honor this classic dessert.
holidays.funFact: Lemon meringue pie gained popularity in the 19th century but really skyrocketed when lemon juice and meringue were discovered to be a perfect pairing!

holidays.name: Independence Day (India)
holidays.description: A major national holiday marking India‚Äôs independence from British rule in 1947, filled with flag hoisting, parades, and patriotic celebrations.
holidays.origin: Officially recognized since August 15, 1947, when India became a sovereign nation after decades of struggle
holidays.funFact: The first Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, delivered his iconic 'Tryst with Destiny' speech on this day at midnight.
